required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Refractive Accuracy of "2WIN" and Portable Autorefractors
clinical_study.official_title: The Refractive Accuracy of Photoscreeners "2WIN" and "PlusoptiX" and the "Retinomax" Auto Refractor

brief_summary.textblock: Youth and some adults have photoscreening refractions and hand-held auto refraction before cycloplegia refraction during new and follow up eye examinations. Vector math is applied to each refraction to determine how closely the hand-held "dry" devices match actual refraction.

detailed_description.textblock:
A closeness-of-fit algorithm utilizing vector transformations of astigmatism is designed and applied to 50-years of clinical international refractive experience.
As a part of new and follow up comprehensive eye examinations, patients and parents consented to confirm the cycloplegic refraction to other portable refractive tools.
The ability of photoscreeners "2WIN" ("Adaptica," Padova italy), "PlusoptiX A12" (Nuremberg, Germany) and "Retinomax" (Righton, Tokyo, Japan) to match actual refraction is assessed utilizing the new algorithm.
This algorithm could then be applied to batches of donated spectacles distend by charitable organizations worldwide if portable auto refracting devices are employed.

primary_outcome.description: Vector transform J0 and J45 astigmatism
Spectacle comparison score (Percent similarity combined sphere-cylinder)

secondary_outcome.description: Spectacle similarity score striated by age relative to patient's ability to accommodate

intervention.description: non-cycloplegic refraction by "Retinomax K+" auto refractor

study_pop.textblock: children and adults attending pediatric ophthalmology and adult strabismus clinic

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patient undergoing new or follow examination at pediatric eye and adult strabismus clinic Willing to undergo screening refractive device developmental delays included
Exclusion Criteria:
- Intraocular lens in place

reference.citation: Arnold SL, Arnold AW, Sprano JH, Arnold RW. Performance of the 2WIN Photoscreener With "CR" Strabismus Estimation in High-Risk Patients. Am J Ophthalmol. 2019 Nov;207:195-203. doi: 10.1016/j.ajo.2019.04.016. Epub 2019 May 9.

patient_data.ipd_description: de-identified database shared on www.ABCD-Vision.org Website.
